meanings.definition: Outmaneuvers (verb): to outwit or outsmart an opponent in a strategic or tactical situation.
meanings.sent1: She outmaneuvers her opponents by thinking ahead.
meanings.sent2: The skilled chess player outmaneuvers their rival with clever moves.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outmaneuvers the cat in a playful game of chase.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking outmaneuvers any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The detective outmaneuvers the criminal, solving the case in record time.

meanings.definition: Outmaneuvers (noun): the act of outsmarting or outwitting an opponent in a strategic or tactical situation.
meanings.sent1: The outmaneuvers of the spy impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: In war, strategic outmaneuvers can lead to victory.
meanings.sent3: The outmaneuvers of the clever fox left the hunters baffled.
meanings.sent4: Her outmaneuvers in negotiations secured a great deal.
meanings.sent5: The outmaneuvers of the escape artist amazed the audience.
